import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os

    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
sns.set_style('darkgrid')
source.3397d8cd:
plt.figure(figsize = (20,12))
sns.countplot(x = data['Injuries/Casualties'],palette="winter")
plt.title('Number of Casualties')

source.07a6016e:
plt.figure(figsize = (20,15))
sns.barplot(x = data['Type'].value_counts(),y = data['Type'].value_counts().index,palette="winter")
plt.xticks(rotation = 90)
plt.title('Type of Casualties all over world')
plt.show()
source.c848e7d3:
plt.figure(figsize = (20,15))
sns.barplot(x = data['Country'].value_counts(),y = data['Country'].value_counts().index,palette="winter")
plt.xticks(rotation = 90)
plt.title('Number of incidents per countries')
plt.show()
source.3ff3a7c6:
data_india = data[data['Country']=='India']
plt.figure(figsize = (20,15))
plt.subplot(2,2,1)
sns.countplot(x = data_india['Type'],palette='winter')
plt.title('Type of casualties in India')
plt.subplot(2,2,2)
sns.countplot(x = data_india['Injuries/Casualties'],palette='winter_r')
plt.title('Number of casualties in India')
plt.show()
source.0ed2ea7b:
data_USA = data[data['Country']=='United States']
plt.figure(figsize = (20,15))

sns.countplot(x = data_USA['Type'],palette='winter')
plt.title('Type of Casualties in United States')
plt.subplot(2,2,2)
sns.countplot(x = data_USA['Injuries/Casualties'],palette='winter_r')
plt.title('Number of casualties in United States')
plt.show()

They repeatedly ignored warnings advising them to move away from the blaze.
